did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the United States Marine Corps Paymaster's Office. Materials include: reconciling statements; specifications for ship building and repairs; and requisitions, bills, and receipts. Correspondence in the collection includes that of Major W. B. Slack, Quartermaster; Major H. B. Lowry, Acting Quartermaster; W. W. Russell, Paymaster; and Arthur Peterson, P. A. Paymaster at Pensacola, Florida, and Mare Island, California. The collection also includes "Watch Quarter and Station Bills" for the USS Pensacola from 1885. The oversize volumes consist of one volume of payroll returns (1863-1867), one volume of payroll records (1862-1871), 4 volumes of quarterly payroll records (1865-1870) and 5 volumes of letterbooks for the Paymaster's Office (1848-1864).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
